description.raw:
From #982:

I've seen a few failures of the [ForceTorqueSensor_TEST/CreateForceTorque test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-raring-amd64/321/testReport/junit/%28root%29/ForceTorqueSensor_TEST/CreateForceTorque/), which appear to be caused by an uninitialized variable (failure at [gazebo/sensors/ForceTorqueSensor_TEST.cc:68](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/default/gazebo/sensors/ForceTorqueSensor_TEST.cc#cl-68):
~~~
gazebo/sensors/ForceTorqueSensor_TEST.cc:68
Value of: math::Vector3(0, 0, 0)
  Actual: 0 0 0
Expected: sensor->GetTorque()
Which is: 2.42305e+242 -3.13745e+242 0
~~~

I initially thought that the wrenchMsg in [ForceTorqueSensor::GetForce](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/default/gazebo/sensors/ForceTorqueSensor.cc#cl-93) was uninitialized, so I added a test to UNIT_msgs_TEST, but that wasn't the problem. I left the test anyway.

I then tracked down the dJointFeedback struct which contains several vector and is allocated without initializing them in `ODEJoint::SetProvideFeedback`, so I made sure to initialize them.
description.html:
From #982:

I've seen a few failures of the ForceTorqueSensor_TEST/CreateForceTorque test, which appear to be caused by an uninitialized variable (failure at gazebo/sensors/ForceTorqueSensor_TEST.cc:68:

gazebo/sensors/ForceTorqueSensor_TEST.cc:68
Value of: math::Vector3(0, 0, 0)
  Actual: 0 0 0
Expected: sensor->GetTorque()
Which is: 2.42305e+242 -3.13745e+242 0

I initially thought that the wrenchMsg in ForceTorqueSensor::GetForce was uninitialized, so I added a test to UNIT_msgs_TEST, but that wasn't the problem. I left the test anyway.

I then tracked down the dJointFeedback struct which contains several vector and is allocated without initializing them in ODEJoint::SetProvideFeedback, so I made sure to initialize them.

title.html: Fix uninitialized value (#982)
